ARABIC: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ ٱتَّقُوا۟ مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيكُمْ وَمَا خَلْفَكُمْ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُرْحَمُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: They are told, 'Have taqwa of what is before you and behind you so that hopefully you will have mercy shown to you.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: When it is said to them: "Beware of what is before you and what is past, that you may be treated with kindness;"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: When it is said to such people: “Guard yourselves against what is ahead of you and what has preceded you that mercy be shown to you” (they pay scant heed to it).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Whenever they are told to guard themselves against sin and the forth coming torment so that perhaps they could receive mercy
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And when it is said to them, “Beware of what is before you and what is behind you, in the hope of your gaining mercy”, they turn away!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And when it is said to them: "Beware of that which is before you, and that which is behind you, in order that you may receive mercy."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And when it is said to them: Guard against what is before you and what is behind you, that mercy may be had on you.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And when it is said to them, 'Fear what is before you and what is behind you; haply you will find mercy' --
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: When it is said unto them: Beware of that which is before you and that which is behind you, that haply ye may find mercy (they are heedless).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: When they are told, "guard yourselves against what is before you and what is behind you, in order that you may be shown mercy," [they turn away].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And when it is said Unto them: fear that which is before you and that which is behind you, that haply ye may find mercy, they withdraw.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: And when they are told, ‘Beware of that which is before you and that which is behind you, so that you may receive [His] mercy…’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: When they are told, "Fear ye that which is before you and that which will be after you, in order that ye may receive Mercy," (they turn back).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And when it is said to them: "Beware of that which is before you (worldly torments), and that which is behind you (torments in the Hereafter), in order that you may receive Mercy (i.e. if you believe in Allah's Religion Islamic Monotheism, and avoid polytheism, and obey Allah with righteous deeds).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: When it is said to them: 'Have fear of that which is before you and behind you in order that you find mercy'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Yet when it is said to them, “Beware of what lies before you, and what lies behind you, that you may receive mercy.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: But when it is said to them, "Beware of what is before you and what is behind you; perhaps you will receive mercy... "
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [36:45] And when it is said to them, ‘Beware of that which is before you, of the chastisement of this world, as [it is said] to others, and that which is behind you, of the chastisement of the Hereafter, that perhaps you might find mercy’, they turn away [in aversion].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (When it is said unto them) when the Prophet (pbuh) said to the people of Mecca: (Beware of that which is before you) of the matter of the Hereafter; you should believe in and strive for it (and that which is behind 500 you) of the matter of this worldly life, such that you do not become deluded by it and by its splendour, (that haply ye may find mercy) in the Hereafter and do not get tormented.
